meanings.definition: A small piece of meat, typically breaded and fried.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious cutlette for dinner last night.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served crispy cutlettes with a side of vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The cutlette was so tasty, it danced in my mouth!
meanings.sent4: Her cooking skills turned a simple cutlette into a gourmet delight.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the sizzling cutlette filled the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: I will cutlette the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent2: She carefully cutletted the paper into tiny squares.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cutlette the cake into bite-sized portions.
meanings.sent4: The tailor will cutlette the fabric to create a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent5: The chef will cutlette the ingredients for the stir-fry dish.

meanings.definition: A small, thin slice of meat.
meanings.sent1: The sandwich was filled with a flavorful cutlette of ham.
meanings.sent2: She placed a juicy cutlette of beef on the grill.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to steal a small cutlette of chicken from the table.
meanings.sent4: The chef skillfully arranged the cutlettes of turkey on the platter.
meanings.sent5: The market offered a variety of cutlettes, from pork to lamb.
